headline: These Stocks Moved Moving the Most Today: Dayforce, Novo Nordisk, GoodRx, UnitedHealth, Sunrun, Duolingo, TeraWulf, and More
summary: Stocks were flat on Monday, but things will heat up later this week with a number of key retailers, including Walmart, are scheduled to issue quarterly earnings reports.  There will also be Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell’s speech Friday at the policy symposium in Jackson Hole, Wyo.  Dayforce  jumped 26% after Bloomberg reported that private-equity firm Thoma Bravo was in talks to acquire the HR management software company.

headline: Thoma Bravo nearing deal to acquire software firm Dayforce, source says
summary: Shares of Dayforce, which has seen its stock lose more than 27% of its value so far this year, were up about 29% in late-afternoon trading.  Dayforce had a market value of $8.44 billion as of Friday's closing price.  Dayforce offers a cloud-based human capital management platform that includes payroll, workforce management, benefits, talent management, compliance and analytics.

headline: Paycom (PAYC) Stock Trades Up, Here Is Why
summary: Shares of HR software provider Paycom (NYSE:PAYC) jumped 3.3% in the afternoon session after the stock gained on M&A speculation within the human resources software sector, following a report that private equity firm Thoma Bravo is in talks to acquire competitor Dayforce.

headline: Why Are Dayforce (DAY) Shares Soaring Today
summary: Shares of human capital management software company Dayforce (NYSE:DAY) jumped 27.6% in the afternoon session after reports emerged that the company is in advanced talks to be acquired by private equity firm Thoma Bravo. The news, first reported by Bloomberg, suggests a deal to take the Minneapolis-based human resources software provider private could be announced within the next few weeks. While a sale price wasn't disclosed, some reports valued the potential transaction at over $9 billion. The

headline: These Stocks Are Moving the Most Today: Dayforce, Novo Nordisk, GoodRx, UnitedHealth, Sunrun, Duolingo, and More
summary: Stocks were mixed Monday with a number of key retailers, including Walmart, scheduled this week to issue quarterly earnings reports, and ahead of Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell‘s speech Friday at the policy symposium in Jackson Hole, Wyoming.  Dayforce  jumped 27% after Bloomberg reported that private-equity firm Thoma Bravo was in talks to acquire the HR management software company.  Dayforce and Thoma Bravo didn’t immediately respond to a request for comment from Barron’s.

headline: Thoma Bravo Is Said to Be in Talks to Buy Software Firm Dayforce
summary: Shares of Dayforce rose as much as 28% on Monday for their biggest intraday gain in more than seven years.  Representatives for Thoma Bravo and Dayforce didn’t immediately respond to requests for comment.

headline: Dayforce Stock Surges 23%. Why Wall Street’s Excited.
summary: Dayforce  stock was soaring in early trading Monday amid a report it’s about to be bought out by a private-equity firm.  The company, which provides human resources software and had a market value of $8.4 billion as of Friday’s close, gained 23% to $65.11 just after the market opened.  On Sunday, Bloomberg reported that Thoma Bravo was in advanced talks to acquire the company.

headline: Air Canada, Soho House, Dayforce: Trending Tickers
summary: Air Canada (AC.TO) stock is in focus after the company suspended its full-year guidance, as nearly 10,000 flight attendants are on strike. Soho House (SHCO) is going private in a $2.7 billion deal led by MCR Hotels and backed by Ashton Kutcher. Dayforce (DAY) stock is skyrocketing on news that private equity firm Thoma Bravo is in talks to take the software company private, according to Bloomberg.  To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.
